answers: maya nut is the roasted seed of the tropical tree Brosimum alicastrum. It can be used to make a rich, naturally caffeine-free drink or a versatile flour.
When you ask “What is maya nut?”, it’s the seed of Brosimum alicastrum – a tropical tree whose seeds can be roasted, ground, and turned into drinks and foods.
maya nut is the seed of the Brosimum alicastrum tree. It’s been used for centuries in its native range as a food and drink.
People use the name “maya nut” for the seed of Brosimum alicastrum. Roasted maya nut can be brewed as a drink or milled into flour.
Brosimum alicastrum is the scientific name for the maya nut tree. It belongs to the Moraceae family, like mulberries and figs.
When you see Brosimum alicastrum, that’s the Latin name for the tropical tree whose seed we call maya nut.
Ojoche, ramón, breadnut, and guaimaro are different common names for the same species, Brosimum alicastrum, in different regions.
Yes, names like ojoche and ramón usually refer to the maya nut tree or its seeds, depending on local tradition.

The MayaNut Company is focusing on warm parts of Florida, especially South Florida below about 27°N, where Brosimum alicastrum can handle winters more easily.
Our early trials are in subtropical South Florida. Over time we hope to learn exactly how far north the maya nut tree can be grown in Florida.
